author: Special Correspondent
text:
Kapu reservation movement leader and former Minister Mudragada Padmanabham has said that he and his followers are ready to go to jail and that he will not apply for bail if arrested by Tuni police in connection with arson, violence including the burning of Ratnachal Express on January 31.

In a letter to DGP J.V. Ramudu, he said that he was ready to furnish all the details of his supporters who attended the meeting and also ready to hand over the registration numbers of vehicles used to attend Kapu Garjana. He alleged that bind-over cases were being booked and rowdy sheets opened against his supporters in connection with Tuni incident. He added that Sections 144 and 30 were promulgated on the orders of the DGP and false arrests are being made by Tuni police for the reported violation of the Section.
title: Ready to go to jail, says Mudragada
